Heavy metal stabilization and remediation refers to the addition of stabilization agents to soil to transform exchangeable heavy metals into residual states, reduce the solubility and migration performance of heavy metals, and reduce their toxicity to the ecological environment

quantitativeReference.functionalUnitOrOther: The functional unit of this study was set to equally remediate 0.07 ha (1 mu, Chinese area unit) of Cd contaminated paddy fields, and the remediation goal is to reduce the Cd concentration in rice to the national safe use threshold of rice (0.2 mg/kg), with a time horizon of 30 years to obtain long-term impacts.

locationOfOperationSupplyOrProduction.descriptionOfRestrictions: The study site is a paddy field contaminated by Cd, located inGongzhuang town, Huizhou city of the Pearl River Delta, Southern China.

technology.technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse: Lime addition does not reduce the total Cd content in soil but can reduce the bioavailability of soil Cd. As a result, the Cd content in rice plants decreases. The remediation reagent is fully mixed with the surface contaminated soil (depth: 0–20 cm) through mechanical mixing. After remedial action, the remediation reagent is not removed
添加石灰不会降低土壤中总镉含量，但会降低土壤镉的生物利用度，导致水稻植株中镉含量下降。修复试剂通过机械搅拌与表面污染土壤（深度：0-20厘米）充分混合。补救措施后，补救试剂不会被移除
technology.technologicalApplicability: The process described pertains to the agricultural industry, specifically aimed at reducing heavy metal toxicity in contaminated paddy fields. The use of lime for in-situ stabilization mitigates cadmium contamination through the stabilization of heavy metals. This process converts exchangeable heavy metals into residual states, thus lowering their bioavailability and mobility. It serves a critical role in ensuring the safety of agricultural produce, particularly rice, by attempting to meet national safety standards for heavy metal content in food crops.
该过程涉及农业领域，尤其是减少受污染水田中重金属的毒性。利用石灰进行原位稳定通过稳定重金属来缓解镉污染。此过程将可交换态的重金属转化为残渣态，从而降低其生物可利用性和迁移性。它在确保农产品安全，特别是大米，试图满足食品作物中重金属含量的国家安全标准方面，起着关键作用。

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: When utilizing this dataset, users should note that the process is specifically suitable for the treatment of cadmium contamination in paddy fields. Users should incorporate the lime treatment into the LCA only where similar environmental and soil conditions apply. It is important to understand that lime addition targets the bioavailability of cadmium, rather than its total concentration in the soil, and that the remediation agent remains in the soil post-treatment. As such, the modeling should consider a long-term horizon to capture the ongoing impact of the treatment over an indicated period of 30 years.
在使用此数据集时，用户应注意该过程特别适用于水稻田镉污染的处理。用户应仅在存在类似的环境和土壤条件时，在LCA中纳入石灰处理。重要的是要理解石灰添加旨在针对镉的生物可用度，而非土壤中镉的总浓度，且修复剂在处理后会留在土壤中。因此，建模应该考虑长期的预测，以在指明的30年期限内捕捉处理的持续影响。
